Reviews.Title: “A good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tar_k_A572
Reviews.Content: Rafael hoteles diagonal port is close proximity to the coast. However, it is far from metro station (15 minutes walk nearly) and far from central. Internet connection is limited to lobby area. This is an handicap I think in the internet era. But in other aspects, It is a good hotel. Personal are trying to help to inhabitants of the hotel. In short, I love catalan culture and barcelona and I like this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: amanah
Reviews.Content: Although on the outskirts of Barcelona it was easy to get around on the metro and the room was spacious and very clean.The hotel lived up to it's expectations and provided everything stated in the hotel description. The service at reception was good, however the internet connection in the room was a bit iffy and we could only use in the hotel reception. Breakfast was not as good as other buffet breakfasts we have had but was sufficient. Good value for money in Barcelona if you don't mind a bit of walking. It rained so we didn't get the chance to check out the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Very good price for a 4**** but don't expect luxury”
Reviews.Author: Tudor0206
Reviews.Content: The location is great, the beach is across the street. The area is so quiet and beautiful, new buildings, relaxation areas. The hotel looks ok, might need some refurbishments (especially the wooden floor and furniture). The breakfast is wonderful, probably the best 've eaten in years; so various and tasty. I totally recommend the hotel for a city trip, the price is very good for a 4**** hotel but don't expect luxury. Metro is 5 - 7 mins away - station Poblenou.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time”
Reviews.Author: Babs030660
Reviews.Content: I booked the flights a while ago but only after looking at trip adviser I found this hotel, perfect location as I wanted the best of both worlds the City and the beach and this was perfect. the hotel was very clean the rooms were a good size and really nice. The staff were very helpful, the breakfasts were excellent value and gave a great start to our day. Would of loved tea making in the room that's our only disappiontment as the Tea in the restaurnat at breakfast is not good. Trams, buses make it so easy to get about, just a 5 minute walk to the beach which is fanstatic, even went on the train to Stiges along the coast for the day which is well worth a visit. Tour buses a must as so much to see with brilliant audio guide....had a brilliant time and will definately be back. Next time 2 nights in Barcelona and 2 nights in Stiges. 25th March - 29th.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: spinje01
Reviews.Content: I am used to spending the night in a hostel for only 11 euros a night. Although this hotel was better than this, there were a few parts that made it unworthy of the price. For example, the ethernet chord did not work with my laptop and so I had to pay for the wireless in the rooms, which is 9.48 euro for 24 hours. I believe that wireless should be completely free, it is ridiculous that this can not be accommodated when hostals that charge 7 euro a night can provide me with this. Great service tho, they all spoke english and the people were very friendly. The complimentary breakfast was great though - with "eggs" (kind of gross) but good, fresh juice, toast, iberia ham and ice when asked. Very clean though and new towels which can be rare. No shampoo but quarter size soap provided. If you want to go to affordable, Spanish shopping walk down the Mar and visit Centro Commercial, where al the locals shop (warning, it is equipped with American fast food. Late night after coming home on the metro, visit the piano bar around the corner on the beach, and allow chico to play you a tune.

Reviews.Title: “It's average, but it does what it needs to do.”
Reviews.Author: craiglegrice
Reviews.Content: Barcelona is a wonderful city - and if you're coming here for pleasure, there are dozens of hotels to stay in - from the cool modern beachfront towers to sexier, hidden townhouses. But, if like me on recent trips, you are coming to the city to work, Hotel Rafael is great. It's small, well located and extremely friendly. For less than €100 per night, you get a clean and good sized room, great staff and a decent breakfast. They'll call you a cab, they'll help with directions, they speak perfect English, they will help with anything you ask if they can. It's not contemporary, it doesn't have WiFi (although the in room ethernet access is good and free), it won't win many design awards and I wouldn't necessarily book it for a romantic city break. But it's a very nice and safe bet in a city that can be eye-wateringly expensive one week for no apparent reason.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and view, but thats about it”
Reviews.Author: skd555
Reviews.Content: Location and neighborhood was great, but hotel was run down, no wifi and no complimentary breakfast. Not bad considering the price

Reviews.Title: “Nice - but a little rundown”
Reviews.Author: henningn
Reviews.Content: Visited this place for a week in late october, early november 2011. The place is nice - I enjoyed the neighboorhood eventhough its a bit out of the way of Downtown Barcelona. Poblenou it's called. Head for Rambla de Poblenou for nice restaurants, and Bilbao 34 for a greal local place. As said the hotel was ok - but my room was a little rundown. Slighty dirty, lightbulbs that doesn't work, thins hanging loose on the wall etc. Not a big problem - but it does cost a star. Not many people on the hotel. It's probably more busy in summer where location close to the beach is a plus. As usual in these hotels breakfast, dinner and wi-fi is way to expensive. Head for a local internet-shop 100 yards away and you will get internet-access for almost no money - and for breakfast head out for Bilbao 34 - or one of the many restaurants and bars in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel with great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Magols
Reviews.Content: Four-star near the beach. A few blocks to the nearest subwaystation and a couple of stops from place de la Catalunya. Possible to walk to las Ramblas in less than 30 min. Helpful staff and very clean standard.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PGWAT
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was great. Friendly staff, large, clean room and great breakfast. Easy to get to the city centre via bus or Metro. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: alastairdeacon
Reviews.Content: Solid hotel choice in Barcelona. Got this hotel on Priceline for $100/night. Barcelona hotels seemed expensive when I was looking, so I was happy with this rate. Hotel is out of the way from the city center but there is a bus stop, the #41 about a block away from the hotel that will take you there for 1.45 euros. This hotel is easy walking to the beach and there's a park close by. The room itself was clean, wood floors, small but acceptable shower/bath. Nothing fancy about it, but serviceable and safe. We asked about wifi and was told that was an additional 20 euros. She immediately offered us a cord and said we could have dial up for free, which, being dial up was slow, but for confirming flights and doing what was necessary, worked out for us. Pleasant people on the front desk. Solid, practical spot to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, close to the beach but far from the Center of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: GuneetS
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband at the hotel for 2 nights in Nov 2011..Initially we had some problem finding the Hotel as the Google directions from the nearest metro station ( Pobleneu) were not that accurate. It took us almost 1-1.5 hr to find the hotel ( though it is only a 10 minute walk from the metro, which we found later after we got a hang of the roads). Our room was spacious and had a good sized bathroom..But had no view of the sea..The hotel is only 10 min walk from the beach..and 20 min walk to Barceloneta beach..Breakfast was very good...Had some good Spanish omelettes which we both liked a great deal..The staff was very friendly and gave us some good advice on the roads and bus stations..Even helped us to get a print of our HOHO ticket voucher which we had forgotten :) Free wifi but could be assessed only in the Reception area which was a bit irritating..Rooms were cleaned during the day..The only problem was that the Hotel was not nearer to the center of the city..The nearest Hop on Hop off bus station was a good 20-25 min walk ( which we njoyed as we took the way along the beach)..Lots of cafes, pizza places around the Hotel.Overall stay was good with no problems at all !! would recommend the hotel if the distance from the center is not an issue !!!

Reviews.Title: “Too costly for the proposed offer...”
Reviews.Author: iogima
Reviews.Content: As part of our trip to Spain we stayed at rafaelhoteles for two night ( september 24 and 25 ) and we were not impressed by the offer. Positive: Good location ( close to the beach ) Less positive: A bit far from old parts of the city. View is not great specially if you're in the inner court. Room are correct size, no more. Personnal were ok . . Pricing was way too much for that type of offer. We were kinda expecting more from that pricing range. If you look you can find a better deal

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Brenda64
Reviews.Content: We just spent 10 days at this hotel, and I can't recommend it enough! The room was spotless, and cleaned perfectly every day. The bed was the most comfortable I've ever slept in, and the pillows were exactly the right size. I hate huge pillows that crank your neck too high up in the sky. The breakfast buffet had everything I can think of to eat at breakfast, and then some. We had a huge breakie every day and then were good to go for hours and hours. The staff at the hotel were exceptional: friendly, helpful, pleasant, and went out of their way to make sure we had a wonderful stay. Every night I would get hot water from the little ground floor bar to make my herbal tea, and the lovely girl there insisted we didn't need to pay anything. (but I gave her a tip, of course!) The beach was right across the road and I had great swims every day. BEAUTIFUL beach!!! White sand for many kilometers, bars at intervals where my husband who doesn't like to stretch out in the sun like I do could repair for "cervezas". Usually we don't ever go back to the same place because we like to travel to different countries and different parts of these countries, but we will definitely be back there next year, since there are so many things in Barcelona we didn't have the time to do. And we will DEFINITELY be back at this hotel. Also, it is right on bus route #41 which took us downtown very cheaply. Actually, we went all over on the buses which was great because we got to meet many local people. (Talking is one of my favourite activities as anyone who has met me for 6.4 seconds realizes - GRIN - so that is why I speak English, French, and Spanish - more opportunities to TALK!) Oh, I must mention what a SAFE city Barcelona is. Over 3 million people, and outside our hotel single women were out jogging and rollerblading at 10:30 p.m. and much later. Try doing THAT in a city of that size anywhere else in the world. When I set off to do some things on my own one day, and needed to transfer to a different bus, the bus driver and all the other passengers had great conversations to help me out. The language spoken is Catalan, and if I only spoke Spanish, I would have been totally lost, but my French allowed me to figure out what they were saying pretty much all of the time, and they didn't give up till I did: much pointing and as long as you can do derecha (right) and izquierda (left), it's doable! Yes, we got lost a few times, but that was just an opportunity to talk with lots of local people doing the old left & right until we got UNlost! What a relaxing, wonderful holiday we had!

Reviews.Title: “Its people who make places....”
Reviews.Author: angester
Reviews.Content: While this hotel was 4 Star Spanish style (i.e. I don't think it would be ranked as such in Ireland due to the decor and fact its quite outdated) the staff would make me come back in a heartbeat. I was in Barcelona for work and had the good fortune to be put up in this hotel for one night. Check-in was fine and I was absolutely exhausted so decided to eat in the hotel restaurant rather than venture out. I arrived close to 9 and there was nobody else in the restaurant (a few others came in later). The waiter and waitress were absolutely fantastic. They could not do enough to make my meal as satisfying as possible. I would go back just to eat there again! Nothing else of real note as I was only there one night but its a great location really close to the beach with nice streets behind it and free wifi in reception. Rooms are clean and functional and the extras in the bathroom are pretty impressive (toothbrush/razor etc!)

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: PatGreystones
Reviews.Content: A very well located Hotel. Very near a good beach. Only 10minutes from the metro at Poblenou. The 41 bus stop, to the centre of Barcelona, was only a couple of minutes down the street. The open topped Bus Turistic stopped nearby also. An hours walk along the sea front brought you into the heart of Barcelona. The area felt safe by day and night with the sea front full of joggers, walkers, roller bladers and romantics at night. The room was of a reasonable size and very clean. The breakfast at €14.60 was a bit expensive so we did not partake, there was plenty of alternatives nearby. The reception were competent and helpful. The price was good for Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Definately be back at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: darren s
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, nice location, close to beach and restaurants at olimpic port. Bit further to main centre of Barcelona (La Ramblas etc), but a nice walk (approx 1 hour max). (Some excellent restauants in the small streets behind the hotel). Second year in a row at this hotel and again the service was first class, staff very friendly, very helpful and rooms cleaned to a high standard daily. Will definately be staying at this hotel again, excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Lauren H
Reviews.Content: We were a bit disappointed with this hotel. The front desk staff was pretty cold. Our room was small. The hairdryer and mini-fridge were both broken and the mattress was the hardest I've ever slept on. The whole hotel is very outdated. Their services (laundry, breakfast, Internet) were also fairly pricey. I would NOT rate this as a 4-star hotel. The location was ok. It's about a 15 minute trip to the center of the city by metro. The metro stop is a 10 minute walk from the hotel. The one good thing is that it's close to the beach (although, be warned that the nearest beach is clothing optional). The neighborhood grew on us over the week that we visited. If you do stay here, head to the Rambla de Pablo Nao for the best food/drinks/ambiance in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: Smilero
Reviews.Content: Hotel was good value. Quite basic. Seems to be aimed at business people. There was a tiny bar with nobody drinking there so we went elsewhere which wasnt a big deal. Rooms were comfortable with good air con. Bed was fine. Tv was not working properly. Signal was poor. the walls are also paper thin so you are likely to hear everything your neighbours are doing! 15 walk from 'poblenau' metro station and only 10 minutes from the beach. The facilities on the beach are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, spacious and must try!!! Do not miss.”
Reviews.Author: YogeshGoel
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with wide expansion. My sweetheart was so happy I can't simply tell you. They have thought of their customers so well I simply can't define their perfectness. To our amazement there was free complimentary wine drinks chilled ready on our table with some eatables. It is located in a very good place. Just a walk away there is the coastline. It is away from the crowd which we loved very much. Its near to the city-tour-bus stop. We happen to find out a Chinese restaurant nearby and they made us the vegetarian-Chinese with pleasure. The hotel staff is sweet, good, caring and helpful. They have the cable-internet in the rooms and the wi-fi is in the lobby. They do provide with the cable-wires. They have so much to offer in the bathroom and in the room. They provide whatever one human can require for in a hotel. When we went to the floor we really felt we were in a lovely hotel which is really huge. Everything clean and tidy. They even have a huge breakfast area which serves quite a lot of stuff. Too much for a breakfast. Really wide-spread. We both enjoyed our stay a lot here and we would love to be there again if given a chance. Rooms are also quite big and even the bathroom was quite spacious. Everything is beautifully made.

Reviews.Title: “stay out,unlless no other alternative”
Reviews.Author: salsaib
Reviews.Content: Expensive for 125 euros per night,far from everything,uncomfortable beds,you can feel the spings in your back,limited service hours,unhelpfull staff.We stayed in 5 hotels in Spain over 11 days.All were very good and delightfull.We are a family of 5,all adults and we all agree.This is an 80-90 Euro per night if no alternative.It takes 10-15 Euros per trip to go where action is downtown.It may have been a 4 star when built years ago.Compared to the other hotels we sayed in that were 4 star,it is 2-3 maximum.I knew something was wrong when they charged for 2 days for 2 rooms upfront.People must have left after one day as we considered doing if we had time.Oh and you can smell the sewer in the bathroom sometimes.The rooms were clean.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: ramblingeevie
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights in this hotel before going on a cruise, we had a nice room on the side with views over the sea and along the coast. Room was clean, comfortable and bright. Reception staff were exceptionally helpful, pleasant and took time to assist with directions and information, providing maps, leaflets etc. Although hotel is quite a bit out of the city, public transport running from outside hotel to city centre and approx 15 minutes walk to catch city tour bus. We found the location ideal after being out and about in the city all day it was nice to leave the hustle and bustle behind. We did not use the restaurant in the hotel (although did look very nice) we opted for Chinese meal, next block along which was great value for money, there are also a few reasonably priced restaurants/tapas bars nearby where you can eat or just have a drink..

Reviews.Title: “good price,good quality”
Reviews.Author: p_sepideh1978
Reviews.Content: located in modern part of the city, near the beautiful beach, easy transfer facilities like bus,metro,touristic buses stop, rich breakfast buffet ,clean, frindly staff

Reviews.Title: “Would definately stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Bee056
Reviews.Content: My friend and I have just returned from our trip to Barcelona staying at the Rafael Digaonal port. After reading some of the more recent reviews I was a little worried, didn't know what to expect well I can honestly say we would return to this hotel should we go back to Barcelona. It was very clean and comfortable. The staff were all friendly and very polite. We had no complaints at all. It is a little way out of the city but you know that on booking if you look at map, however the bus stop is just opposite hotel, we got tickets for the hop on hop off tour bus and enjoyed the walk along the sea front to the olympic port which is where we got the bus. I would say a stroll along there took us about 20-30 minutes, or it would have had we not been stopping on the way taking in the sights, having a coffee and popping into the shopping centre. The location was perfect for us. Thank you .

Reviews.Title: “Business Traveller's nightmare...”
Reviews.Author: towelholder
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel the two previous years with a good experience. Perhaps the management has changed since, as this time my experience is nothing short of an irritating nightmare. Upon check-in I received a junior suit on the other side of the hotel even though my companion was here one day before and reserved the room clearly pointing out the side we wanted to stay on (in spanish). After complaining I wanted to pick another room for one night, until we can move to the previously chosen side. The receptionist said that he's not refunding the difference between the room prices because he offered a junior suit and it's my problem that i'm not taking it. Upon complaining that I indicated exactly which suit I want and that it's not just any, he said he wasn't on duty that day and I should wait and come back the following day. Upon changing suits the next day I found that the new has thick layers of dust all over on the furniture and flying around in the sunshine. Within minutes my laptop screen needed wiping. Upon complaining at the reception, the receptionist (another person, but equally bright) cheerfully explained that it is becuase of the blanket in the room. With 3 degrees celsius I was very suprised at her shock when I suggested that perhaps they should wash the blankets now and then. As a plus point the phone wasn't giving an external line. After alerting the reception, I had to call them to dial numbers for me all day (one person came by to look at the phone by the afternoon, but did not fix it). By the last confcall I needed to attend the number I gave could not be reached from the reception, to which the receptionist told me i "can come down and use the coin pay phone in the lobby" to attend the internal conference call of my company. In spite of the junior suit and the price it comes at there is not even a bottle of water included. The elevator has been out of order for three days now with the whole of the HP conference attendees crowding the hotel running up and down the staircase to escape their floors. A pity, all of this, as my first two experiences were reasonably pleasant. The hotel's receptionists and management (though they speak some basic english) lack communication skills altogether and like to point their guests to what they should do - instead of coming up with solutions. DO NOT STAY HERE - if you like efficient service and cleanliness. There's none of this to be found at Rafael Hoteles Diagonal Mar.

Reviews.Title: “Find another hotel if you can...”
Reviews.Author: MarcoPoloDenmark
Reviews.Content: Well, 4 stars are not just not right – it is almost a joke… The maintenance level is somewhere around zero: One of the 2 elevators was out of order during our entire stay. Toilet paper holder was broken, mirror was broken. Uneatable chocolate in the mini bar. The hotel has 10 irons in total – after I finally got one I locked it in the safe during the day – the only way to make sure that you get one… The wired internet is free, but nobody is able to connect – a good opportunity for the hotel to earn money on wireless scratch cards… Bottom line – find another hotel…

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but a little far out from city center”
Reviews.Author: triptaker0508
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our week long trip to Madrid and Barcelona. We won this hotel through Priceline with a very low bid, so we definitely liked the price. The room was clean and quiet, and the front desk staff was very helpful. The only real problem with this hotel is that it is a bit far out from the city center. We didn't mind that so much, but it was about a 10 minute walk to the nearest Metro station. We were probably spoiled because in Madrid the Metro stop was right outside the front door of our hotel. The walk wasn't bad though, it just added extra traveling time overall. We would have preferred being a bit closer to the city center, but we were definitely able to make this work.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: bogdan81
Reviews.Content: We've just came back from a 5 day trip to Barcelona and found this hotel to be really good value for money. The hotel is located no more than 5 minutes walk from the beach and not far from the city centre (a taxi costs around 10 euros to get there). The staff was really helpful and friendly all the time and made excellent recommendations regarding places to visit or restaurants. We were mainly satisfied by the cleanliness of the hotel; the room was cleaned daily with towels changed everyday and sheets every 2 days. Breakfast was excellent, costs 9 euros/person and there was a pretty decent variety of foods to choose from. So overall I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are looking for beach/sun and nightlife which fortunately you'll find plenty in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for the beach, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: JustGiveMeAirCon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not central but it's literally across the road from the beach. It's a five minute walk from the metro to bring you to the city centre - about 20 minutes on the train. The hotel itself is comfortable and very clean and beds are changed every day. Breakfast is good and the staff are nice. By Barcelona prices this is a great value place to stay and perfect for the beach. If you want to be in the city it's not the place for you though. For me the biggest drawback was the price of WiFi - WAY overpriced and nowhere in the hotel to use internet unless you had a cable. My smartphone does not!

Reviews.Title: “One Night stop over”
Reviews.Author: esenior
Reviews.Content: As part of a group of 12, some of whom were disabled, some were elderly and some were young. We were pleasantly surprised by this hotels ability to cater for our mixed needs. Given we were only there two days with one night the staff were very helpful and provided English speaking assistance were needed. Arriving too early to book in which is at 2pm we were allowed to store all our luggage in safe keeping while we visited a large shopping mall ten blocks away. On our return the rooms were quickly allocated and we made our way to what were clean, tidy, well equipped and reasonably spacious double rooms. [ Two negative points were, 1. There was no assistance provided for taking luggage to the rooms and 2. At breakfast there was a large patch of damp on the ceiling away from the main eating area, with a small drip of water coming from a light unit above the main eating area that was just missing a guest as it fell onto the floor. While this lasted only a few minutes in was disconcerting as one did not know were the water originated . It was pointed out to a member of staff who took note but while I was there nothing was done to move other guests from the area the water was dripping into.]

Reviews.Title: “Terrible attitude!!”
Reviews.Author: yesvol
Reviews.Content: We've been travelling with a Turkish group and this hotel is booked by our tour operator. Hotel is located far away from the center of the city, however there is a metro stop 5-6 minutes walk away, therefore it was not an issue. The main problem was the POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE. On the first morning; I and my husband entered the main room and picked up a plate but we were stopped by a rude waiter.We put down our plates and left, in fact the hotel management had divided the rooms for groups, but there was no sign anywhere showing it, you had to guess where your eating location was :) by searching, we had found the room which was reserved for our group. While we were eating, we heard a real big argument between our tour guide and a waitress. The reason of the argument was this : even they had divided the rooms; the breakfast service was'nt full in all the rooms, half of the assortments were missing in our group's room and no person was there for serving or checking our needs. Also, they were not letting people to enter the main room to pick something to eat or drink. On top of all, one of the service person kept shouting at our tour guide and touching his arm with anger. She finally had a nervous breakdown.We had an extremely stressfull morning thanks to the hotel service.I personally had a very big disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Far far away from center should be 3 star instead of 4”
Reviews.Author: VTI
Reviews.Content: First impression; I have to carry my own luggage to the room, no bellboy or no other staff even offered to help me, and no one did show the way to our room. The hotel is on sea side, but we were there on february so no use for us to be that close to sea. The hotel is far from city center and any cultural activity. The room does not have any carpet on floor. TV is old fashioned, bathroom amenities are adequate but to have a shower curtain in a 4 star hotel bothers me. Breakfast is good enough but remember to bring your water heater if you intend to drink something hot, because so called hot water and cafe are not! The room and bathroom are clean, breakfast buffet is sufficient. Overall they sould call it a clean 3 star hotel instead of 4 star!

Reviews.Title: “Good but far from everything”
Reviews.Author: Alemati
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good, clean and it has a nice and frinedly staff. The room it is good too for european standards But it is a litle bit far from the most atractions, so taxis or metros will be needed. Metro it is not so far from the hotel and easy to get. I can recomend this hotel, but the person can not mind about location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean,comfortable and good localization”
Reviews.Author: J_Alfredo
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Barcelona and stayed 4 nights at this hotel and had a really good impression of it! The rooms were large and comfortable, the staff very polite and the breakfast was very good. It´s located in a nice neighboorhood ("Poblenou"), close to the beach and to the subway. The internet service (high speed) in the room also worked very good!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, reasonably convenient”
Reviews.Author: megt4
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a conference at the CCIB, which is about a 15-20 minute walk away. It is reasonably convenient, but a little far from the metro (about 8 blocks). Clean and generally pleasant. There was some construction next door that started fairly early in the morning, so not great if you want to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “A good experience”
Reviews.Author: Bouqueriaman
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel at a great rate, probably because of the building work going on at the one side of the hotel. The hotel itself was very well presented and attractive. It is very modern, but the art work on display makes it interesting to look around. The reception staff were friendly and helpful. However do be careful if booking taxis through them. We took a taxi up town and were charged almost 19 euros. We were amazed when we took the return journey and it cost less than six!!! Check the rate when you are picked up- the meter should be on about 2 euros at pick-up or you are about to be ripped off. As with all the hotels breakfast is expensive, so take a short walk to the left and eat at one of the perfectly fine small cafes for half the price and less. Mar Bella beach is a short stroll across the dual carriageway, you wont need a swim suit! We have been in the sea in December twice here- it is bracing but a great experience. The tube is about a 10 minute walk away. The room was modern and bright with a really nice bathroom. The only negative was the building work outside our window, but they can't help that and the rate reflected it. I would be very happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoolsG4
Reviews.Content: Just came back from two nights at this hotel. The hotel itself is excellent. Cannot complain at all about the staff, facilities, rooms, cleanliness etc. The location was great for my wife and I. Literally 2 minutes (across the road) from the beach. A very pleasant walk along the sea front towards the centre of the city took about 30 minutes. If you're not into walking far the Poblenou Metro station is about 7 minutes walk 3 blocks away. The only thing I would make people aware of is that if your room looks out onto the "Carrer de Lope de Vega" (the main street the hotel is located on), then there is some major building work going on in the plot across the road. We were woken both mornings around 8am by pneumatic drills, lorries reversing, banging etc. We visited from 20-22 October 2008, and the building work was in its very early stages, so I presume it will continue for many months. As we are both early-risers the noise didn't bother us though, and maybe you can request a room not on that side of the hotel. We would definitely go back to this hotel again, and it suited us great.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!! For a 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: KandyKane056
Reviews.Content: This hotel in Barcelona is awesome! The rooms are very modern, even hard wood floors. Bathrooms are very spacious, plenty of hot water. It is in front of the beach. To go to the metro is 4 blocks away. Safe and quiet area. Breakfast includes eggs, ham, bacon, pastries, fruit and yogurt. After staying in this hotel my expectations for other 2 star were raised.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Nice Hotel near beach”
Reviews.Author: WhoNeedsAName
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 3 nights for 75 euro/night including breakfast. Plus tax of 1.07% came to roughly 82 euros. Very nice hotel, clean, no issues. We stayed on the 5th floor, so it was quiet. We had what looked like a handicap accessible room, but it wasn't a problem. It was right across from a great beach and we quickly figured out the transportation into town. The yellow line or the 41 bus. Our only "nit" was that the hotel charged us 3 euros per beach towel to use. That was in our opinion in poor taste. Taxi back to airport was 35 euro, but it is what it is to get a beach location. Considering that hostels with private bath go between 60 and 80 euros, it was well work it. GIven that the dollar exchange rate absolutely sucks, a 75 euro nice beach front hotel was appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: fabmc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice, the rooms are spacious and very comfortable, and the hotel staff is friendly too. The hotel location is quite far (20 min. walk) from center (the Ramblas), but it is very close to the beach (5 min. walk). If you're traveling by car, it is very easy to find a free parking spot just 10/20 meters from the hotel main entrance. I would recommend this hotel for people looking for a safe and quite area of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Secret hotel can't hide everything......”
Reviews.Author: Minoue-Sisteron
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in May 08 for two nights with my wife. We picked up one of top secret hotel of Lastmin. Since it was four stars, we were expecting something great, but it turns out that it was an OK hotel. A few train stops from down town Barcelona. 30-min-walking distance from Barceloneta along beach. 5 min walk from the nearest metro station and very quiet and safe neighbourhood. Nice reception and staff. Everything seemed to be great until we enter the room. It was stinky. Smell was like sewage. Actually entire floor had bad smell. So, we went to the reception and ask to change the room. Surprised that they knew the situation, and still put customers in rooms (it was weekend though). Second they said they would put perfume in the room, but it would be gone in a few hours?!?! Finally, they found another room for us in a room with smell of smoke. (We are non-smokers) Smoke is better than sewage, so we decided to stay. Probably it would not be a bad hotel if there was not this problem, but letting customer stay in this kind of room was not normal. Well, secret hotel cannot hide everything.

Reviews.Title: “Rafael hotelesGraet Hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: BuzzLightyear54
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just spent 3 nights at this hotel for a Barcelona City Break. The hotel was spotlessly clean, the room was excellent and the staff were friendly and helpful all the time we were there. We loved the location, as it was a quiet safe spot next to the beach, with easy access to town or tourist spots using Metro or bus. The metro station was a pleasant 5-10 minute walk through Poblenou, which we found to be a nice area. Recommend taxi to and from airport (25 Euros) and Metro or Bus everywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: poppytigi
Reviews.Content: I have just had 4 nights at the hotel. Very good, clean and adequate accommodation. The buffet hot & cold breakfast is well worth the 13.50 euros which cater for lots of tastes. We had late night snacks on the terrace at reasonable prices. The receptionists are very helpful and the Food & Beverage Manager Ricardo placed a bottle of "Bubbly" in my room for my 50th birthday. Just 10 mins walk north of the hotel is Diagional mar a large shopping arcade and lots of eating outlets, just besides the forum. The best way to travel about is by taking the No 41 bus from almost outside the hotel into the center of Barcelona 1.25 Euros. Purchase a Bus Turistic pass 1 day = 19 or 2 day = 23 Euros - you can hop on and off all day seeing all the sights over 3 tours - well worth the money. If your in Barcelona for more than 2 days take a trip down to "Sitges" 30mins by train south 5 Euros from the main train station. A lovely fishing village with great beaches and good restaurants/bars. OH! use taxi's they are dirt cheap before 12pm airport to hotel 20 Euro, 8 euro from the town center to hotel. I can recommend the hotel - very good

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: wolf_ffm
Reviews.Content: On searching a hotel with good value for money we found Rafaelhoteles Diagonal Port. Most of the other cheap hotels were far out of Barcelona and normally did not have breakfast included. Rafaelhoteles Diagonal Port is in Poblenou, between Olympic Port and Forum. Not really a very nice region, but at 10 minutes walking distance from the next metro-station. The hotel is quite new, modern style, nice and clean rooms, friendly staff and we had a very good breakfast-buffet included in price. We felt quite safe there: You find a safe for free in the room and there are cams everywhere in the hotel... We stayed at Diagonal Port in February 2007. At this time there was a construction site in front of the hotel (see picture). The hotel is in short walking distance to a beach too, maybe interesting in summer. In case you are not bothered by the distance to the metro station, we think it is a good place to stay when you want to explore Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice but a bit far away from the centre. There is a good 10-12 min walk from the Metro stop Poblenou.We also tried once using the bus from Placa Catalunya. The rooms are nice with a stacked mini bar.The breakfast is average.
